page.title: 07INDUSTRY
page.content: In a pleasant wooded area full of birds and animals is a sewage works.Sid, Roy and Len work there and told us about the works. The rather out of date plant collects sewage from south of Billericay.It gravitates through pipes into a screen which removes bulky materials. The sewage flows into settlement tanks where the solids settle to the bottom and cleaner water laps over the top through more pipes,into the spinklers. Water pours through holes in pipes.As these rotate,the water goes through circular clinker beds.Clinker is porous and like a hard sponge. As water seeps through,the bacteria in cavities feed on impurities in the effluent.Next it filters through sand beds which finally "polish"the water. From settlement tanks it goes to the river.
